title: Vincent D'Onofrio teases casting in DC's The Batman after Zoe Kravitz
text:
Vincent could be gearing up to play the movie’s villain (Picture: Getty/Metro.co.uk)

Vincent D’Onofrio has sent DC fans into meltdown after teasing his involvement in upcoming flick The Batman.

Director Matt Reeves revealed the cast is very much coming together when he tweeted a gif of Zoe Kravitz on the phone, revealing her role as Catwoman.

With the gif being captioned ‘Hello?’, Men In Black actor Vincent sparked even more speculation by retweeting and replying: ‘Hey Matt.’

While nothing has been confirmed, DC fans are running with it and are theorising that he could be set to star as the movie’s villain.

Vincent has sent fans into meltdown (Picture: Twitter)

We’re already sold.

‘Falcone? I could see it,’ one pointed out, referring to Bruce Wayne’s gangster nemesis, nicknamed The Roman in the comic books.

‘Get in. We have Gotham to take over,’ another added, with one more saying: ‘Legends supporting legends love that. unless you’re teasing involvement then i love it even more [eyes emoji].’

DC fans are eyeing him for the villain role (Pictures: Twitter)

We’re going to need more info as soon as humanly possible.

The 60-year-old has previously starred in movies including Full Metal Jacket, Jurassic World and Men in Black, as well as Netflix’s series Daredevil.

It seems everything is falling into place for the movie, despite initial backlash over Robert Pattinson’s role as Batman.

Meanwhile, according to several publications including The Hollywood Reporter, Zoe managed to fend off stiff competition from the likes of Ana de Armas, Ella Balinska and Eiza Gonzalez for the role of Catwoman, after they all reportedly sat down for a table read with R-Patz the first week of October.

Robert is set to play Bruce Wayne (Picture: Getty Images for Entertainment Weekly)

Producers are said to have narrowed down their options to two actresses just recently and Zoe, 30, reportedly scooped the coveted spot.

Reeves is set to direct the anticipated blockbuster after taking over from Ben Affleck who stepped down in 2017.

Ben, 47, also departed his role as Batman after Justice League leaving a big space for Reeves to pick a new Caped Crusader.

R-Patz was confirmed as the new Batman in May and admitted it was a dream come true to don Batman’s famous cape.
